lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg, the billionaire former mayor of New York City, is once again weighing a third-party bid for the presidency, frustrated by what he sees as a race gone haywire, associates said.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.main: Bloomberg, Sensing an Opening, Revisits a Potential White House Run

snippet: Michael R. Bloomberg, the billionaire former mayor of New York City, is once again weighing a third-party bid for the presidency, frustrated by what he sees as a race gone haywire, associates said.
abstract: Former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg is reportedly considering independent third-party run in 2016 presidential election, sensing gap among declared candidates; Bloomberg has considered independent run in past, but never followed through due to low likelihood of winning; alarming rise of Donald Trump and stumbles by Hillary Clinton have caused him to reconsider.
